channel.title: Porting question
channel.description: Just a quick question. Trying to help a friend get his server up and he is getting a porting error "no route to host" well that does seem obvious what the error is but I am not sure myself. I have in the router under port forward both udp/tcp 43594 and also in the firewall I have made exceptions for 43594 tcp/udp inbound rules.

item.title: Porting question
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:2, topic:465834”]“no route to host” on what? are you trying to ssh in and are getting “no route to host” ???

what os of host and client ?[/quote]windows 7 I believe

Read full topic
